channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: These fans have sung their way to the National Women's Soccer League finals
item.description: The Washington Spirit takes on Gotham FC on Saturday in San Jose, Calif.
item.content:encoded:
The Washington Spirit takes on Gotham FC on Saturday in San Jose, Calif.

(Image credit: Luke Chávez)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Main Character of the Week: Reaction to Rini
item.description: NPR's Mia Venkat explains what the internet was obsessed with this week.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mia Venkat explains what the internet was obsessed with this week.
item.dc:creator: Mia Venkat

item.title: Senate Democrats are investigating the Kennedy Center for 'cronyism, corruption'
item.description: Senate Democrats say the new Kennedy Center leadership has led to "millions in lost revenue, luxury spending, and preferential treatment for Trump allies." The performing arts center denies the allegations.
item.content:encoded:
Senate Democrats say the new Kennedy Center leadership has led to "millions in lost revenue, luxury spending, and preferential treatment for Trump allies." The performing arts center denies the allegations.

(Image credit: The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: A new Miss Universe is crowned, weeks after she left a pageant event in protest
item.description: This year's Miss Universe competition, held in Bangkok, was marred by a series of dramatic incidents, from a contestant's livestreamed walkout to a now former judge's allegations of rigging.
item.content:encoded:
This year's Miss Universe competition, held in Bangkok, was marred by a series of dramatic incidents, from a contestant's livestreamed walkout to a now former judge's allegations of rigging.

(Image credit: Lillian Suwanrumpha)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Shakespeare's unhappy marriage takes center stage in 'Hamnet'
item.description: A new film, adapted from Maggie O'Farrell's 2020 novel, posits that the death of Shakespeare's 11-year-old son may have inspired one of the greatest fictional tragedies ever written.
item.content:encoded: A new film, adapted from Maggie O'Farrell's 2020 novel, posits that the death of Shakespeare's 11-year-old son may have inspired one of the greatest fictional tragedies ever written.
item.dc:creator: Justin Chang

item.title: Marking 65 years of Hitchcock's 'Psycho' with actor Janet Leigh
item.description: Leigh shares stories about Psycho, including the infamous shower scene. Also, screenwriter Evan Hunter talks about working with the Hitchcock on his next film, The Birds. Originally broadcast in 1999.
item.content:encoded: Leigh shares stories about Psycho, including the infamous shower scene. Also, screenwriter Evan Hunter talks about working with the Hitchcock on his next film, The Birds. Originally broadcast in 1999.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: 'Wicked: For Good' is in theaters, along with 'Zodiac Killer Project' and more
item.description: Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo are back in theaters for the second half of 'Wicked' this week, while Brendan Fraser plays an actor in stand-in roles in strangers' lives.
item.content:encoded:
Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo are back in theaters for the second half of 'Wicked' this week, while Brendan Fraser plays an actor in stand-in roles in strangers' lives.

(Image credit: Giles Keyte)
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: Artists respond to a cultural squeeze during the 'Fall of Freedom'
item.description: Artists in more than 40 states are spending Friday and Saturday participating in the "Fall of Freedom" – which they say represents a creative resistance to authoritarianism.
item.content:encoded:
Artists in more than 40 states are spending Friday and Saturday participating in the "Fall of Freedom" – which they say represents a creative resistance to authoritarianism.

(Image credit: JP Yim)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: Pras Michel of the Fugees sentenced to 14 years over illegal campaign donations
item.description: The Grammy-winning artist was sentenced on Thursday to 14 years in prison for a case in which he was convicted of illegally funneling foreign contributions to former President Obama's 2012 campaign.
item.content:encoded:
The Grammy-winning artist was sentenced on Thursday to 14 years in prison for a case in which he was convicted of illegally funneling foreign contributions to former President Obama's 2012 campaign.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The limitations of trash TV, as seen in 'All's Fair'
item.description: Ryan Murphy's trashy melodrama further cements his parallels with Lee Daniels and Tyler Perry. But even fans of "so bad it's good" trash TV would throw their hands up in agony at Murphy's new show starring Kim Kardashian.
item.content:encoded:
All's Fair.'/>

Ryan Murphy's trashy melodrama further cements his parallels with Lee Daniels and Tyler Perry. But even fans of "so bad it's good" trash TV would throw their hands up in agony at Murphy's new show starring Kim Kardashian.

(Image credit: Ser Baffo)
item.dc:creator: Aisha Harris
